ygData.subject: Re: NEAT Libraries?
ygData.msgSnippet: In the first generation your population gets initialized with random weights. You should prevent that. Your initial population should not mutate that genome

In the first generation your population gets initialized with random 
weigh=
ts. You should prevent that. Your initial population should not 
mutate tha=
t genome when it is spawned. I mean the weights must they 
the same as they=
 are loaded. Make the initial weight mutation power 
equal to 0. I think th=
ere is a constructor with a parameter where you 
can specify this. NEAT::Po=
pulation(Genome* g, int size, double 
power). 

Cheers,
Peter

--- In neat@=
yahoogroups.com, "Chris Spencer" <chrisspen@...> wrote:
>
> Another thing I=
've noticed, is if I take the best genome (fitness
> 12.36) from the output=
 of one xor test, and use that as the
> xorstartgenes, then the next test's=
 best genome actually has a lower
> fitness (fitness 11.28).
> 
> Is that t=
he expected behavior?
> 
> Why would starting out with the "right" solution=
 cause it to end up
> with a less right solution? Shouldn't the second expe=
riment's best
> genome have a fitness no lower than 12.36, or am I misunder=
standing
> something?
> 
> Regards,
> Chris
>

<chrisspen@...> wrote:

 rtNEAT doesn't 
implement

sults of evolution? 
There seems

a file, but nothing for 
saving or

rks. Do you have any

lement this?
